page.title: 15BRIERLEY HILL GLASS CO. 03
page.content: Intaglio work is a design of thin cuts and dull and shiny patterns. First they cut the shiny design and dip it in acid. Then they cut the dull design but don't dip it in the acid, this part remains dull and white. Cased glass is becoming rare because it takes a long time to learn how to make it. You get a clear glass and blow a coloured glass over it. Coloured glass is made by mixing in chemicals and a little gold. The layers are fused together by heat then a pattern is cut through the coloured layer to the clear. An example from Brierglass is a l.5 m tall vase which is the largest example of cut glass in the world. Another one is a vase costing Â£4000. It is so expensive because it has an intaglio design cut into into cased glass and it took 3 men 3 months to complete.
